Params: DEAD MASTER's domain gradually collapses, the surroundings reverting to their pre-battle state.
Isn't it about time you let me go?
I'm a bit reluctant to admit it... But with this...
A victor has been declared in this game.
I felt... distracted for a moment.
What...? What just happened? I opened the door and then... what took place?
What are you planning to do?
Alpha's eyes are drawn to the "King", a solitary figure standing before the throne.
What's wrong, not a fan of lively scenes?
That room couldn't host so many people, so I thought we'd move elsewhere.
Indeed, you've won. How does it feel, exhilarating?
I've said it before, even if you win, nothing will change.
We're just circling back to the beginning.
I'm slowly coming to terms with this reality.
In other words, now is also the "beginning."
No matter where you go or how fate twists and turns, "you" will never change... right?
This would be the ideal moment to conclude the chapter if there were more space.
But this is a story born from an "error."
Perhaps it should end in an "erroneous" way.
In the blink of an eye, the "King" makes her move.
She summons a crimson rapier, aiming it at you.
Lucia is the first to react, trying to activate her thruster to block the King's path, but her feet are suddenly ensnared by crimson thorns bursting from the ground.
The rapier rapidly approaches, but at that moment, your eyes catch a glimpse of crimson lightning.
Alpha raises her sword in defense, but to her surprise, the "King" neither dodges nor deflects Alpha's attack.
Instead, she allows the blade to pierce through her chest.
The "King's" smile is twisted as she grips Alpha's hand, guiding the blade deeper into her wound, inch by inch.
The deeper the blade penetrates, the closer she gets to Alpha.
Eventually, her figure fills Alpha's vision.
As the "King" draws nearer, a soft glow emanates from Alpha's left hand, hinting at the stirring of her dormant Punishing Virus.
A deep red energy seeps out, finally forming a storm that envelops them both.
A girl is sitting at a distance, picking up scattered chess pieces from the ground and resetting them on the board.
She steps closer to the girl, who also notices her.
Do you remember the way home?
Do you remember what Mom and Dad used to tell you, Luna?
One day, you'll have to go home on your own.
When you get home, I will be there waiting for you.
The girl stands up, gives her a lingering look, and begins to walk away.
The King's figure starts to fade away, her words of malice left hanging in the air.
Feeling the Punishing energy within her calm down, Alpha turns around to face Lucia and the others.
We all know what we must do next.
This alternate-dimensional space hasn't collapsed yet.
The creator of the castle is gone, but her "influence" still lingers.
Wait... what are you trying to do? Shouldn't this be something for the Craftsman to handle...
Eh? Where did the Craftsman go? She's gone?!
I've achieved my goal. What happens next is irrelevant to me, but...
My purpose has never changed from the beginning.
She raises her sword toward Alpha.
Is she going to confront us...
Feeling the hostility emanating from those blue eyes, Lucia instinctively readies her sword in response.
We are an unexpected "error" to Corridor.
To them, our existence is no different from the "King".
I'm afraid that going forward, many Mental Images will see us as the enemy.
But we were allies just moments ago...
What are you afraid of, Lucia?
We are "errors," things that must be eradicated...
Even so... a world that can only tolerate "correctness" is in itself the biggest "error."
So, how will you prove it?
Two red katanas aim in the same direction, as ice and thunder start to resonate together.
Hey! What are you guys doing?! Hasn't everything already ended?
Intimidated by the standoff, Fida steps back in fear.
The battle between me and my dear "nemesis" has indeed come to a pause.
But the fight with my "best friend" is just beginning.
Clutching her scythe, DEAD MASTER moves to stand beside BLACK★ROCK SHOOTER.
You... aren't going to stop them?
You could join them, you know.
I have no interest in stirring up trouble here with you all...
Sometimes, the reasons for "battle" vary widely.
Not all fights stem from hatred and hostility.
Our journey isn't over; it seems we'll be lingering here a bit longer.
And our steps won't stop here.
With a heart full of questions, she summons her courage, lifts her head, and faces this newly transformed "battlefield."
She captures the silhouettes of the four individuals in her eyes.
For a moment, she feels the fleeting gaze of the girl in black.
This is the beginning of a new "conflict".
Then, the girl's eye ignites with a flame.
She sees burning meteors, and icy comet tails.
Clashing stances, hearts seeking to unite.
Not just a single conclusion, but a myriad of possibilities.
She sees different destinies intertwining here.
